context: The word 'viikuna' in Finnish means 'fig'. It refers to the fruit of the fig tree. The word declines based on grammatical case, as shown in the dictionary definition, indicating its role in a sentence (nominative, genitive, partitive etc.).  It can also be used in plural form ('viikunat') and has possessive forms depending on who owns the figs (e.g., 'viikunani' - my fig).
